meanings.definition: Move or cause to move rapidly from side to side
meanings.sent1: The dog wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent2: She wagged her finger to signal 'no'.
meanings.sent3: The wind wagged the branches of the tree vigorously.
meanings.sent4: The pendulum wagged back and forth with precision.
meanings.sent5: The boat wagged on the rough waves, making everyone dizzy.

meanings.definition: Move or cause to move in a playful or teasing manner
meanings.sent1: The puppy wagged its tail playfully.
meanings.sent2: He wagged the toy in front of the kitten.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child wagged the treat, teasing the dog.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel wagged the nut just out of reach, taunting the bird.
meanings.sent5: The magician wagged the wand, casting spells with a grin.
